No Additional Materials are required. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 385, 400]]<|/det|> ## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 411, 718, 482]]<|/det|> Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in. Write in dark blue or black pen. You may use a pencil for any diagrams or graphs. Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid. DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 494, 253, 509]]<|/det|> Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 520, 758, 551]]<|/det|> At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 72, 816, 92]]<|/det|>
An IGCSE class is carrying out this experiment to determine the mass of a metal bloc

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 104, 437, 122]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.1 shows a spring drawn full size.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 134, 762, 153]]<|/det|>

<form>l_1 = .................................................................... cm</form>
